AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where the events took place, involved in the case of IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050 area: rural area characterized by ranches and a wind farm, with limited traffic, where vehicles with out-of-town registrations raised suspicions, frequently and increasingly used to circumvent checkpoints
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: law enforcement agency encountering illegal aliens, with agents trained to observe specific behaviors and signs indicative of smuggling activity
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer immigration checkpoint: location where Agent Montemayor arrived to conduct interviews with RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: a two-lane road where observations were made, with sharp turns and no shoulder, used by ranchers and oil trucks, location of drop-offs for illegal aliens, has a wind farm with an office and entrance on the west side, characterized by limited traffic, mostly used by local residents and workers, frequently and increasingly used to circumvent checkpoints
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 16 and U.S. 59: Location of the intersection where the traffic stop took place, near the Freer immigration checkpoint
